alert.note: Alert for Sonoma (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 21 at 4:16PM PDT until further notice by NWS Monterey
info.description: .Rain continues through the evening but will continue to diminish as low weakens. River and stream gauges showing rise in water levels. Minor roadway flooding and flooding near streams possible. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following county, Sonoma. * WHEN...Until 715 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 412 PM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 0.8 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.1 to 0.3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Rosa, Petaluma, Rohnert Park, Sebastopol, Cotati, South Santa Rosa Cdp, Forestville and Graton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
